sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使人不安或烦恼"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: bother, disturb, trouble, annoy, irritate, vex
means: bother ： 指使人烦恼而引起的紧张不安或感到不耐烦。
disturb ： 较正式用词，多用被动态。指拢乱，使人不能平静或妨碍别人工作、思维或正常秩序，是程度较深的烦恼。
trouble ： 指给人在行动上带来不便或在身心上造成痛苦。
annoy ： 强调因被迫忍受令人不快、讨厌的事而失去平静或耐心，多指一时的打拢或恼怒。
irritate ： 语气比annoy强得多，指激怒，使发怒，多指一种短时间的反应。
vex ： 侧重指因不断的干扰而引起的烦恼，有时含激怒的意味。

sentence.Network_en: Mr Brooke is undoubtedly in a spot of bother.
sentence.Network_cn: 布鲁克先生肯定遇到了点小麻烦。

sentence.Network_en: I'll drive you back to your hotel later. It's no bother.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一会儿会开车把你送回宾馆，举手之劳。

sentence.Network_en: The sauce is thick and rich so don't bother trying to diet.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个酱汁又浓又香，别费劲节食了。

list.abs: 何怎么组词_百度知道 ... 何遽[ how] 何苦[ why bother] 你何苦为这点鸡毛蒜皮的事跟他吵 [呢] ?[ is it worth the trouble].

模块九模块十单词短语背诵_laogao_新浪博客 ... bother to do 特意，特地; bother doing 麻烦做某事 be engaged to 与…….订婚.

jx.jx_en_mean: be unwilling to make the effort needed to do something

lj.lj_ly: they couldn't be bothered to look it up.
lj.lj_ls: 他们根本不想花力气去查这件事。

jx.jx_en_mean: in a state of anxiety or physical discomfort, especially as a result of being pressured
jx.jx_cn_mean: （因焦虑或身体不适而感到）心急火燎

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (as a noun in the dialect sense 'noise, chatter'): of Anglo-Irish origin; probably related to Irish bodhaire 'noise', bodhraim 'deafen, annoy'. The verb (originally dialect) meant 'confuse with noise' in the early 18th cent

entry.def: If you do not bother to do something or if you do not bother with it, you do not do it, consider it, or use it because you think it is unnecessary or because you are too lazy.

example.ex: Lots of people don't bother to go through a marriage ceremony these days...
example.tran: 如今很多人不再费心思举行婚礼。

example.ex: Most of the papers didn't even bother reporting it...
example.tran: 大多数报纸甚至懒得去报道这件事。

entry.def: Bother means trouble or difficulty. You can also use bother to refer to an activity which causes this, especially when you would prefer not to do it or get involved with it.

example.ex: I usually buy sliced bread — it's less bother...
example.tran: 我通常都买切片面包——比较省事。

example.ex: The courts take too long and going to the police is a bother...
example.tran: 打官司耗时太久，去找警察也很麻烦。

entry.tran: 麻烦（用于淡化问题的严重性）
entry.def: You use bother to refer to serious trouble, usually when you want to make it sound less serious than it really is.

example.ex: Vince is having a spot of bother with the law.

entry.def: If something bothers you, or if you bother about it, it worries, annoys, or upsets you.

example.ex: That kind of jealousy doesn't bother me...

entry.def: If someone bothers you, they talk to you when you want to be left alone or interrupt you when you are busy.

example.ex: We are playing a trick on a man who keeps bothering me...
example.tran: 我们在捉弄一个总是来烦我的人。

example.ex: I don't know why he bothers me with this kind of rubbish.
example.tran: 我不明白他为何用这种烂事来烦我。

entry.def: Some people say 'bother' or 'bother it' when they are annoyed about something.
If you say that you can't be bothered to do something, you mean that you are not going to do it because you think it is unnecessary or because you are too lazy.

example.ex: I just can't  be bothered to look after the house...
example.tran: 我就是不想费事照看这所房子。

example.ex: Doctors cannot be bothered to explain what they do.
example.tran: 医生们才懒得解释他们所做的事情。

entry.tran: 这不麻烦；不费事；没什么
entry.def: If you say 'it's no bother' after offering to do something for someone, you are emphasizing that you really want to do it and that it will take very little effort.

example.ex: I'll drive you back to your hotel later. It's no bother.
example.tran: 我一会儿会开车把你送回宾馆，举手之劳。

sentences.sentence: "he didn't want to make a fuss"

means.word_mean: 2. something or someone that causes trouble; a source of unhappiness;

sentences.sentence: "washing dishes was a nuisance before we got a dish washer"
"he's not a friend, he's an infliction"

means.word_mean: 1. take the trouble to do something; concern oneself;

sentences.sentence: "He did not trouble to call his mother on her birthday"

means.word_mean: 2. cause annoyance in; disturb, especially by minor irritations;

sentences.sentence: "Mosquitoes buzzing in my ear really bothers me"
"It irritates me that she never closes the door after she leaves"

means.word_mean: 3. to cause inconvenience or discomfort to;

sentences.sentence: "Don't bother the professor while she is grading term papers"
"The mere thought of her bothered him and made his heart beat faster"

means.word_mean: 6. make confused or perplexed or puzzled

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The question is, why would that bother us?

Sentence.sentence: But I'm used to that so it doesn't bother me too much.
I didn't realize I've being bothering you all this time.
Why bother saving when I might not be here tomorrow, they argue.
Two questions often bother first-time corporate bond investors.
He is bothered by the pain in his neck.
Google has reversed this – it has simply copied all these works without bothering to ask.

means.word_mean: 打扰, 烦扰, 搅扰, 使恼怒

sentences.en: Thank you, but please don't bother.
sentences.cn: 谢谢, 但请你不要费事了。

sentences.en: Could I bother you to give the package to Mr.Miller?
sentences.cn: 麻烦你把这个包裹交给米勒先生好吗?

means.word_mean: 迷惑, 把…弄糊涂; (使)不安, (使)紧张

sentences.en: The complexities of life bothered him.

means.word_mean: 令人烦恼的人或事物; 引起麻烦的人或事物

sentences.en: What a bother!We've missed the bus.
sentences.cn: 真恼人!我们错过了公交车。

jushi.chinese: 要不要去请大夫? ——请不要费事了。

jushi.english: Thank you, but please don't bother.
jushi.chinese: 谢谢,但请你不要费事了。

jushi.english: You needn't bother; I can lock the door.
jushi.chinese: 你不必担心,我会锁门的。
